acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-48 hours ErC50=55mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (SIDS, 2005).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,930mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,900mg/kg, 2,102mg/kg and 2,140mg/kg (SIDS (2005)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF<2.4(CERI Hazard Data, 2002)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(CERI Hazard Data, 2002)), it was classified into Category 3.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 157degC (open cup flash test) (SIDS (2005))

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices), described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-62 (2002), Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997) and SIDS (2005).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on several epidemiological case reports that suggest respiratory sensitization in humans (CERI Hazard Data 2001-62 (2002) and MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence from rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2005)): The substance induced irritation of the eye. The effects were not fully reversible on day 10.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (SIDS (2005)): "moderate irritant" (though the results are not those of 4 hour application).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on several epidemiological case reports that suggest skin sensitization in humans (CERI Hazard Data 2001-62 (2002) and MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "The present substance has been known to show strong irritancy, and numerous clinical signs in the eye and respiratory tract have been reported as key effects" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-62 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "reduced activity, bradypnea and prone position, which is reversible within three days" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997)).
